intro: Tricalysia allenii var. australis, commonly known as the Australian tricalysia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
